snippet: If Rio succeeds in disfiguring and dismantling its most historic favela, the path will be open to further destruction throughout the city’s other poor neighborhoods.
abstract: Op-Ed article by advocacy group founder Theresa Williamson and photographer Mauricio Hora criticizes planned Olympic construction projects in Rio de Janeiro, which are threatening to dismantle and disfigure the city's most historic favela; argues that if Rio succeeds in its plan, the path will be open to further destruction throughout the city's other poor neighborhoods.

byline.original: By THERESA WILLIAMSON and MAURÍCIO HORA

lead_paragraph: If Rio succeeds in disfiguring and dismantling its most historic favela, the path will be open to further destruction throughout the city’s other poor neighborhoods.

headline.seo: In the Name of the Future, Rio Is Destroying Its Past
